title: Authors and Citation
text: Kyle Grealis. Author, maintainer. Nick Triplett. Contributor. Gabriel Odom. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Grealis K (2025). nascaR.data: NASCAR Race Data. R package version 2.2.2.9999, https://azimuth-project.tech/nascaR.data/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {nascaR.data: NASCAR Race Data},   author = {Kyle Grealis},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2.2.2.9999},   url = {https://azimuth-project.tech/nascaR.data/}, }

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: ⚠️ Version Notice: version CRAN contains race data 2024 season. GitHub version includes automated weekly updates. updated data available every Monday race season (February November) main branch. See details installing updating. nascaR.data provides historical race results NASCAR’s top three series: Cup (1949-present), Xfinity (1982-present), Trucks (1995-present). Explore driver, team, manufacturer performance race--race, season, career format. data expertly curated scraped permission DriverAverages.com.

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: --date results, install main branch. branch update every Monday: Install stable CRAN version (2024 season): Stable CRAN package updates planned sporadically throughtout season.

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: NASCAR one top-tier racing sports North America competes Formula-1 IndyCar top viewership spot. Approximately 3.22 million people watch race given weekend throughout season. nascaR.data package result wanting share passion sport provide option typical go-packages learning new data cleaning & visualization tools.

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: package provides three main datasets: cup_series: NASCAR Cup Series race results (1949-present) xfinity_series: NASCAR Xfinity Series race results (1982-present) truck_series: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series results (1995-present) dataset contains detailed race information including: Race details (Season, Race number, Track, Name) Results (Finish position, Start position) Performance metrics (Laps completed, Laps led, Points earned) Driver team information Data sourced permission DriverAverages.com automatically updated every Monday 5AM EST racing season (February November).

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: Load package:

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: View dataset documentation:

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: Use suite get_*_info() functions examine specific performace results race--race, season, career level. search race team manufacturer:
code: # Career results across all series get_driver_info("Christopher Bell") Christopher Bell # A tibble: 3 × 8   Series  Seasons `Career Races`  Wins `Best Finish` `Avg Finish` `Laps Raced` `Laps Led`   <chr>     <int>          <int> <dbl>         <int>        <dbl>        <int>      <int> 1 Cup           5            180     9             1         15.1        45321       2435 2 Truck         6             57     7             1          8.5         8132       1216 3 Xfinity       6             79    19             1          9.8        12909       3245 # Season results across all series get_driver_info("Christopher Bell", type = "season") Christopher Bell # A tibble: 17 × 8 # Groups:   Series [3]    Series  Season Races  Wins `Best Finish` `Avg Finish` `Laps Raced` `Laps Led`    <chr>    <int> <int> <dbl>         <int>        <dbl>        <int>      <int>  1 Cup       2020    36     0             3         20.2         9428         18  2 Cup       2021    36     1             1         15.8         8911        100  3 Cup       2022    36     3             1         13.8         8816        573  4 Cup       2023    36     2             1         12.9         8868        599  5 Cup       2024    35     3             1         12.8         9298       1145  6 Truck     2015     7     1             1         11.9         1018        111  7 Truck     2016    23     1             1          9.5         3237        197  8 Truck     2017    23     5             1          5.7         3247        875  9 Truck     2018     1     0            28         28            184         31 10 Truck     2023     2     0             4         10            312          0 11 Truck     2024     1     0             5          5            134          2 12 Xfinity   2017     8     1             1         11.5         1423        156 13 Xfinity   2018    32     7             1         11.1         5112        759 14 Xfinity   2019    31     8             1          9.1         5574       2005 15 Xfinity   2021     2     1             1          3.5          300        174 16 Xfinity   2022     1     0             7          7            147          0 17 Xfinity   2024     2     2             1          1            353        151 get_team_info("Joe Gibbs Racing") get_manufacturer_info("Toyota")

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: package provides rich historical data : Analyzing race trends across series Comparing driver performances Creating visualizations NASCAR statistics

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: ’re open suggestions! ideas new features, please open issue GitHub repository.

title: NASCAR Race Data
text: GNU General Public License (Version 3) Developed Kyle Grealis

what: NASCAR Cup Series Race Data — cup_series
title: NASCAR Cup Series Race Data — cup_series
text: Historical race results NASCAR Cup Series races 1949-present. Includes finishing position, driver car information, track details, performance metrics entry.

title: NASCAR Cup Series Race Data — cup_series
NASCAR Cup Series Race Data — cup_series
text: data frame rows representing car/driver entry 19 columns: Season Race season year Race Race number within season Track Name racetrack Name Official race name Length Track length miles Surface Track surface type (e.g., "road", "oval") Finish Finishing position Start Starting position Car Car number Driver Driver name Team Racing team name Make Car manufacturer Pts Championship points earned Laps Number laps completed Led Number laps led Status Race completion status (e.g., "running", "crash") S1 Segment 1 finish position S2 Segment 2 finish position Rating Driver rating race Win Binary indicator driver won race (1 = yes, 0 = )

title: NASCAR Cup Series Race Data — cup_series
text: Data scraped Driver Averages (https://www.driveraverages.com)

title: Get NASCAR driver statistics — get_driver_info
text: Retrieves summarizes NASCAR race statistics specified driver across different racing series. function provides flexibility viewing career summaries, season--season breakdowns, complete race--race data.

title: Get NASCAR driver statistics — get_driver_info
text: driver Character string driver name (case-insensitive, fuzzy matching available) series Character string specifying racing series analyze. Must one : '' (default) 'Cup' 'Xfinity' 'Truck' type Character string specifying type summary return. Must one : 'summary' (default): Career statistics grouped series 'season': Season--season statistics series '': Complete race--race data

title: Get NASCAR driver statistics — get_driver_info
text: tibble containing driver statistics based specified type: type = 'summary': Career statistics grouped series type = 'season': Season--season breakdown type = '': Complete race--race data

title: Get NASCAR driver statistics — get_driver_info
code: if (interactive()) {   # Get career summary for Kyle Busch across all series   get_driver_info("Kyle Busch")    # Get Cup series statistics only   get_driver_info("Kyle Busch", series = "cup")    # Get season-by-season breakdown for Truck series   get_driver_info("Kyle Busch", series = "truck", type = "season") }

title: Get NASCAR manufacturer statistics — get_manufacturer_info
text: Retrieves summarizes NASCAR race statistics specified manufacturer across different racing series. function provides flexibility viewing career summaries, season--season breakdowns, complete race--race data.

title: Get NASCAR manufacturer statistics — get_manufacturer_info
text: manufacturer Character string specifying manufacturer name (case-insensitive, fuzzy matching available) series Character string specifying racing series analyze. Must one : '' (default) 'Cup' 'Xfinity' 'Truck' type Character string specifying type summary return. Must one : 'summary' (default): Career statistics grouped series 'season': Season--season statistics series '': Complete race--race data

title: Get NASCAR manufacturer statistics — get_manufacturer_info
text: tibble containing manufacturer statistics based specified type: type = 'summary': Career statistics grouped series type = 'season': Season--season breakdown type = '': Complete race--race data

title: Get NASCAR manufacturer statistics — get_manufacturer_info
code: if (interactive()) {   # Get career summary for Toyota across all series   get_manufacturer_info("Toyota")    # Get Cup series statistics only   get_manufacturer_info("Ford", series = "cup")    # Get season-by-season breakdown for Truck series   get_manufacturer_info("Chevrolet", series = "truck", type = "season") }

title: Get NASCAR team statistics — get_team_info
text: Retrieves summarizes NASCAR race statistics specified team across different racing series. function provides flexibility viewing career summaries, season--season breakdowns, complete race--race data.

title: Get NASCAR team statistics — get_team_info
text: team Character string specifying team name (case-insensitive, fuzzy matching available) series Character string specifying racing series analyze. Must one : '' (default) 'Cup' 'Xfinity' 'Truck' type Character string specifying type summary return. Must one : 'summary' (default): Career statistics grouped series 'season': Season--season statistics series '': Complete race--race data

title: Get NASCAR team statistics — get_team_info
text: tibble containing team statistics based specified type: type = 'summary': Career statistics grouped series type = 'season': Season--season breakdown type = '': Complete race--race data

title: Get NASCAR team statistics — get_team_info
code: if (interactive()) {   # Get career summary for Joe Gibbs Racing across all series   get_team_info("Joe Gibbs Racing")    # Get Cup series statistics only   get_team_info("Joe Gibbs Racing", series = "cup")    # Get season-by-season breakdown for Truck series   get_team_info("Joe Gibbs Racing", series = "truck", type = "season") }

title: nascaR.data: NASCAR Race Data — nascaR.data-package
text: collection NASCAR race, driver, owner manufacturer data across three major NASCAR divisions: NASCAR Cup Series, NASCAR Xfinity Series, NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series. curated data begins 1949 season extends end 2024 season. Explore race, season, career performance drivers, teams, manufacturers throughout NASCAR's history. Data sourced permission DriverAverages.com.

title: nascaR.data: NASCAR Race Data — nascaR.data-package
text: Maintainer: Kyle Grealis kylegrealis@icloud.com (ORCID) contributors: Nick Triplett nicholas.triplett@siu.edu [contributor] Gabriel Odom gabriel.odom@fiu.edu (ORCID) [contributor]

text: the_series string specifying race series. Must one 'cup', 'xfinity', 'truck', ''.

text: tibble containing race results specified series.

title: nascar.data 2.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-05-15 Patch fix: closing issue #26 ### Problem Description calling package functions using :: operator (e.g., nascaR.data::get_driver_info()) without first loading package via library(), function fail error: occurred lazy-loaded data objects (cup_series, xfinity_series, truck_series) loaded package namespace functions accessed directly via ::. data load library(nascaR.data) called.

title: nascar.data 2.2.1
text: selected_series_data() function utils.R directly referencing data objects without ensuring loaded. using :: notation, R loads function doesn’t trigger lazy data loading, causing data objects unavailable.

title: nascar.data 2.2.1
text: Modified selected_series_data() function explicitly load required data objects using data() function: ensures data available regardless function accessed, making package robust users prefer :: notation without loading entire package namespace.
code: # Ensure data is loaded even when using :: notation data("cup_series", package = "nascaR.data", envir = environment()) data("xfinity_series", package = "nascaR.data", envir = environment()) data("truck_series", package = "nascaR.data", envir = environment())

title: nascar.data 2.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-02-12

title: nascar.data 2.2.0
text: Added missing races. Cup Series season finale omitted number years 2002 2022. Thank Nick Triplett catching mistake! Seg Points removed. Instead, S1 & S2 variables correspond driver’s finishing position segment. Updated missing track information (length, surface type) 32 Cup races varying years, mostly pre-2000s.

title: nascar.data 2.2.0
text: Updated S1 & S2 documentation.

title: nascar.data 2.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-21

title: nascar.data 2.1.0
text: dev branch updated recent racing results every Monday 10AM race season (February November). New get_*_info() functions provide summary statistics -race, season, career format. Fuzzy matching included search across database respective series

title: nascar.data 2.1.0
text: None

title: nascar.data 2.1.0
text: Updated README vignette reflecting package changes.

title: nascar.data 2.1.0
text: Error handling placeholder race. “DriverAverages.com” site sometimes one row upcoming race. routinely caused issues weekly scraping functions accidentally “recognizing” completed race. oversight addressed removing (essentially) blank row, decreasing index, continuing scrape new race data. Fuzzy finding used within functions returning driver, team, manufacturer information. room improvement: “Chris Bell” find “Christopher Bell” instead “Chris Miller” now. Improvements include stronger focus driver owner’s last name, take trial error really dial .

title: nascaR.data 2.0.0
text: Web data scraped using R packages & removed existing Python scripts. Reduced number datasets Cup, Xfinity, & Truck series results series . Integrated GitHub Actions auto-updating series results

title: nascaR.data 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-07-09 Initial CRAN submission.
